main_definition: Untouched, unprocessed or in its original form.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to something not cooked; natural and uncooked (food).
meanings_and_examples.example: I prefer my steak raw on the side rather than well-done.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fresh, in its original state without alterations or modifications.
meanings_and_examples.example: She showed me her artwork that was still very raw and unrefined.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Crude or blunt; direct and possibly harsh in language or manner.
meanings_and_examples.example: His criticism of the movie's plot was a bit too raw for my taste.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In its original form, unedited or unembellished (text).
meanings_and_examples.example: The author released her manuscript in raw format before it went through editing.
He gave me a raw, no-nonsense look when I asked him about the project status.
